name: ourthings/index.js
ourthings/main.js
ourthings/Queue.js
constructor
description: Class constructor

name: handleFetchErrors
description: Error Handler for fetch calls

name: capitalizeFirstLetter
description: Helper function to upcase first letter of string

name: templateLoader
description: Loads templates from the template stack. Recursively calls self until stack is empty

name: templateProcessor
description:
Template processor
Takes a template, process it and places into the dom

params.name: targetId
params.description: {string|false} - Place in the dom the put the result. In the event of false we process without dom

name: templateVars
description: Process the template looking for {{}} instances

name: jsonVars
description: Process a json object and replace {{!}} tags

name: varsParser
description:
parse a var string

TODO This is massively insecure. If as user can input {{}} into a form and have it displayed
to other users they can take over. We either clean all input as you would with <script> etc tags or we
manually write a parser.

name: templateParse
description:
Takes a template and runs any template commands contained in it to create a HTML template
ready to be put into the dom

name: commandsBind
description: Bind the events to the dom based on the command Object

name: commandsQueue
description:
Take the commands array with command objects in it and add them to the queue *if* they are
marked as instant. IE ready to execute

name: execute
description: Execute a queue that is loaded into prepare

name: queueProcess
description:
Force a queue processing

This launches the actual objects using a timeout

params.name: sync
params.description: {boolean} - Send true to force sync mode (Really only for test mode)

name: findQueueByPid
description: Find a queue item by searching for its PID

name: memory
description: Called by queueables to add something to our memory stack

name: setMemory
description: Set memory that is not associated with a running queueable (IE from the templates)

name: _updateMemoryPerms
description: Flush any permanent memory to cookies

name: _loadMemoryPerms
description: Load perm memory items from cookies

name: getCookie
description: Retrieve a cookie by name

name: cleanMemory
description: Called at the end of a queue run to flush any garbage

name: isWork
description: Is there any work to do in the queue?

name: finished
description:
Called to flag a queue item as finished

 Normally hooked down from queueable this is a queue item saying I have finished in mode (see define.js)

name: commandParse
description:
This will take a command string in the format object.command({},{}); and split it down
into it parts as an object

TODO no concept of the context of the command IE was it from inside a div that need binding?

name: renderToDom
description: Render some text/html to the dom

params.name: domObject
params.description: {object} - The object in the dom to write to

params.name: mode
params.description: {number} - Mode to use while writing see define.js

name: getElement
description: Finds an element in the dom using the jquery formant IE #id .class tag (will only ever return one)

name: getElements
description: Finds an element(s) in the dom using the jquery formant IE #id .class tag (can return one or more)

name: show
description: Show current queue status in the console DEBUG function

name: prettyCommandObject
description: Make a pretty version of the currrent commandObject and dump it to the console

name: reportError
description: Report an error to the console, adds various internal stats

name: deepCopy
description: Deep copy and object IE remove references

get

params.name: json.url
params.description: URL to make GET request to

params.name: json.header
params.description: header object to send (note Content-Type is overwritten by above setting)

name: post
description: Make a POST request

params.name: json.url
params.description: URL to make GET request to

params.name: json.header
params.description: header object to send (note Content-Type is overwritten by above setting)

params.name: json.body
params.description: object to send JSON.stringify is applies to this

name: ourthings/Queueable/Browser.js
redirect
description: Redirect browser to a new page

addClass
description: Add a class to a dom element

name: removeClass
description: Remove a class to a dom element

name: toggleClass
description: toggle a class on a dom element

name: innerHTML
description: Set the HTML of an element

name: formActivityMonitor
description: Monitor element(s) in a form and add classes on change

unknown.tagValue: Internal queue functions exposed to queueables

name: execute
description: Execute a prepared queue

params.name: json.json
params.description: New arguments to send to queue

name: ifqueue
description: Check a statement and run prepared queue if its true

params.name: json.json
params.description: New arguments to send to queue

name: setMemory
description: Set a memory value

params.name: json.value
params.description: value to set (can be any type)

name: ourthings/Queueable/openlayers.js

unknown.tagValue: You need to add "ol": "^5.3.0" to your package.json to build with openlayers

name: addMap
description: Create a new map

params.name: json.map
params.description: name for the map (used to reference)

params.name: json.target
params.description: id of element in the page to target

name: addLayer
description: Add a layer to the map

params.name: json.map
params.description: name for the map (used to reference)

params.name: json.name
params.description: name for the layer (used to reference)

params.name: json.geojson
params.description: geojson to add to the layer (vector)

name: _addLayer_osm
description: Add an osm layer

name: _addLayer_vector
description: Add a vector layer

name: simpleSelect
description: Use the standard openlayers select control

unknown.tagValue: This select control uses the default openlayers model. Useful for applications with no overlapping features. It does not support selecting hidden features

name: addFeature
description:
Add a feature to the Map
TODO: This is old code for getting something working. Needs functionising, not for production

name: zoomToLayerExtent
description: Zoom a layer to the extent of its features (needs appropriate zoom levels to work well

name: ourthings/Queueable/Templates.js
render
description: Render a template into the dom using the queues templateProcessor

params.name: json.template
params.description: dom id of template to use

name: ourthings/Queueable.js

unknown.tagValue: The base class for queueable things

name: constructor
description: Constructor, Sets our status to be false (flipped on init)

name: init
description:
init, override this for any promise based inits setting
the self.ready=true after the promise

name: start
description: Called from queue, starts running the actual command

name: finished
description:
Call this method after you command has finished. Failure to do so will result is
a stalled queue

content:
# OurThings
Queue based JavaScript framework

# Intro
OurThings is a queue based javascript framework designed to take the legwork out of AJAX apps. Originally a closed commercial framework, we are rewriting it and giving it to the world.

# Purpose
After creating ajax site after site we realised that we were repeating the same blocks of code, over and over and always ending up in the same code tangle. Do this, then do this, do that, then call this same piece of code but do something slightly different. After boiling down what we did it became obvious that what every app needed was:
- A queue system
- Flexible code blocks that can be reused
- Common method of passing data between code and UI
- Way to stop coders breaking the UI responsiveness

We also wanted to detach the framework from a need to use javascript. Our UX designers were spending time either writing bad javascript or having to get coders involved for even the most basic of tasks. Thus we wanted to give HTML/CSS users access to the framework in a language they already understand.

# Documentation
[Documentation Site](https://nautoguide.github.io/ourthings/)
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@nautoguide/ourthings",
  "version": "0.1.3",
  "description": "Queue based JavaScript framework",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "webpack --config webpack.config.basic.js",
    "buildbabel": "webpack",
    "apidoc": "esdoc",
    "testserver":"http-server -p 4040 ./",
    "test": "mocha-headless-chrome -f http://localhost:4040/test/test.html -o test/out.res -v",
    "headlesstest": "mocha-headless-chrome -f http://localhost:8080/test/test.html -o test/out.res",
    "dopublish": "node prepublish.js && npm publish src/ourthings && node postpublish.js",
    "dopublish-dry": "node prepublish.js && npm publish src/ourthings --dry-run && node postpublish.js",
    "devmode": "node devmode.js",
    "clean": "node clean.js"
  },
  "main": "index.js",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git://github.com/nautoguide/ourthings.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/nautoguide/ourthings/issues"
  },
  "license": "GPLv3",
  "devDependencies": {
    "chai": "^4.2.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "mocha": "^5.2.0",
    "mocha-headless-chrome": "^2.0.1",
    "ol": "^5.3.0",
    "path": "^0.12.7",
    "webpack": "^4.26.1",
    "shelljs": "^0.8.3",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.1.2",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^3.1.9",
    "@babel/core": "^7.1.2",
    "@babel/polyfill": "^7.0.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.1.0",
    "babel-cli": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.4",
    "http-server": "^0.11.1"
  },
  "publishConfig": {
    "access": "public"
  }
}
name: package.json
